pros: Great culture. Good coworker and team management.
cons: Covid-19 limited interactions. Lot's of changes.

pros: The agency is great for flexibility if needed for childcare or while going to school. Great agency to network with and gain experience
cons: Lack of career growth Work culture somewhat toxic No incentives for hard work Annual merit-based pay increases up to 2% and barely gives bonuses

review_title: Great co workers, very worthy call to help elderly people keep living in their homes in comfort and safety
job_title: Client Care Manager in Lawrence, MA
pros: If you have the call to help people and the patience and energy to do it- you are going to the right place! Benefits and PTO , etc are very good Flexible routine of the day schedule
cons: Supervisors (some) can be an issue of incompetence

pros:
My manager is always okay with time off, she encourages it. 
Benefits start day one! 
The employee fund is fun! You get random prizes, they just hired a taco truck couple weeks ago for a taco Tuesday and we got tacos for free for being a fund member!
cons: No 40 hour weeks, and if hired and put into a new program you have a chance of losing your position in a year when funding runs out :(
They say they are flexible and understand but they aren’t and don’t

job_title: Protective Services Worker in Lawrence, MA
pros: Flexibility in work schedules. Good mission.
cons: Limited promotional opportunities. Pay too low for the toughest jobs.

pros: Time off is reasonable, location is good
cons: Poor management, lack of transparency, low salary, low morale since merge, Danvers location was always second to Lawrence.
Low wages and low wages. Favoritism.

review_title: A workplace that is now acknowledging the need for  some changes.
pros: Great Team Atmosphere. Average pay for  a non-profit. Direct management that is willing to hear your concerns and work toward improvement. Work from home 1 or 2 days per week after a certain amount of time with the company ( I believe it is 6 months). Great clients which make the job enjoyable. Nursing department management acknowledges high work loads and works to help compensate by distributing the work load more evenly.
cons: Too many lengthy monthly meetings that reduce productivity. Upper Management is frequently unwilling to change without excessive amount of complaints. HR is often unpleasant to deal with. Recently moved to a new location which is less than ideal. High case loads. High turnover which leads to increased workloads.

pros: I like to interact with people, to make them feel that it is a great place for their relatives, to make them feel comfortable in this place where you spend most of the time
cons: Dedicate to providing programs and services for elder support them to live well and independently, giving them creativity and confidence.

pros: Decent benefits, flexible hours, weekly training's (no CEU's), able to work from home 1 day weekly. great clients, decent compensation, mileage reimbursement (below average)
cons: Very difficult job, high case load 90+ clients, impossible to get your work done in 40 hours, constant phone calls, management is snarky, sardonic and unsupportive.

pros: Everyone that works here is very nice and friendly.
cons: The pay is low and the caseload it high.

pros: Everyone was super nice and helpful!
cons: No cons were apparent to me.
